poem:
**Rumors on the Wind**

Whispers drift through precincts—  
a ghostly Treno de Aragua,  
spreading like ripples on a pond  
where truth and shadows dance.  
Uniformed hearts quicken,  
fingers hover near triggers.  
Yet when dawn arrives,  
the specter fades—  
just echoes of our own shadows  
cast against the twilight.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Revealed: police across US spread false rumors about Venezuelan gang threats An unverified rumor that Venezuelan gang members were preparing to kill police officers spread like wildfire through US law enforcement agencies last year, internal records reveal, only for federal officials to later quietly acknowledge the claim was mistaken. The intelligence report, which appears to have first been disseminated by a local New Mexico police department in July 2024, suggested that the Tren de Aragua". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
